status: #migration is beautiful. thank you to our #DACA & #undocumented Alumni for sharing your story and experiences; to our @InverHillsCC facilitators helping us understand how we can support & #advocate. kudos to our #MinnStateCDOs for their continued support as noted from our panel

author: ImmJustice
status: Join us for a conversation about DACA, lessons learned, and what an upcoming SCOTUS decision could mean for the movement. Join the Facebook Live on Tuesday, May 5th: https://www.facebook.com/immigrantlegalresourcecenter/

author: repdinatitus
status: The Supreme Court is expected to make a decision soon that could make it harder for individuals to renew their DACA. That’s why it’s important that DREAMers take time today to renew. You can always call my office if you need help.

author: Ness_ribeiroo
status: Thousands of undocumented students are at risk right now with the potential termination of #DACA. RENEW YOUR DACA TO BE PROTECTED AS LONG AS POSSIBLE! Please review the resources below to become informed on your legal status and get our support!

author: NETWORKLobby
status: We know that immigrants make the United States great. With 10,300 DACA recipients working in hospitals across the country, they are crucial to ending the COVID-19 pandemic. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes

author: SenatorDurbin
status: Dr. Manuel Bernal is an emergency room resident at Advocate Christ Medical Center in Chicago. He’s also a #DACA recipient & just one of the many #ImmigrantHealthHeroes working in the health care industry to save lives and stop the spread of #COVID19.

author: AllofUS_United
status: Beating COVID-19 is going to take #AllofUS working together, including the #DACA recipients and other immigrants on the frontlines keeping us safe. Today, we recognize #ImmigrantHealthHeroes for their contributions in the response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

author: theYoungCenter
status: We're so thankful to all front-line workers keeping our communities safe! Join the #ImmigrantHealthHeroes Tweet Storm and share the stories of immigrant health heroes in your community. Here's a #DACA recipient saving lives in New York: https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/policing/2020/04/17/coronavirus-im-front-line-nurse-but-daca-fight-could-mean-deportation/2963866001/

author: kerritalbot
status: Thanks to @SenatorDurbin, @SenatorMenendez & @SenSchumer for fighting for #immigranthealthheroes. Daca, TPS and ag workers are keeping us fed and healthy & they deserve our respect

author: EdithCabelloFdz
status: NSHE Urges DACA Students To Renew Their Applications

author: CrisAlexJimenez
status: We demand that @USCIS does not share the personal information of DACA recipients with ICE! If USCIS does this, it would put DACA recipients on track to be deported!

author: FAIRImmigration
status: Senate Democrats Demand Coronavirus Aid Be Given To DACA Students https://bit.ly/2YjJMYl via @dailycaller @thejasonhopkins

author: UNITEDWEDREAM
status: Jen is a nurse and a DACA recipient working on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic. Jen, and all immigrants are with us in this moment, and deserve to be included in relief efforts. #ImmigrantHealthHeroes

author: MoveOn
status: 14,900 DACA recipients are employed in roles such as cashiers (6,000); stockers and laborers (2,900); and supervisors (1,200) We must protect them and all immigrants because their #HomeIsHere!

author: RAICESTEXAS
status: In case you missed it yesterday... We joined together w/@MaketheRoadNY, @FIRM_Action & @nakasec to discuss what we know about the state of DACA and how to prepare for the future that awaits after the Supreme Court's decision. Watch it here

author: the_ILRC
status: On Tuesday, May 5th, @ImmJustice will host an important conversation about #DACA, lessons learned, and what an upcoming SCOTUS decision could mean for the movement. Don't miss the FB Live convo on the @the_ILRC's page: https://www.facebook.com/immigrantlegalresourcecenter/

author: UNITEDWEDREAM
status: The federal government promised that DACA data was secure from the Deportation Force. Through a FOIA we found out ICE possibly has access to data of DACA recipients. #HomeIsHere Find out what it means for you here: https://www.facebook.com/UnitedWeDream/videos/373994393556313/

author: txknight86
status: Just finished a FaceTime interview with @UnivisionSATX regarding #DACA and the backseat of my car was my background shout out to @UNITEDWEDREAM for the shirt

status: Huge majority of Americans continue to support DACA as Trump escalates anti-immigrant attacks

author: FAIRImmigration
status: Congressional Democrats are demanding COVID-18 relief funds be made available to DACA beneficiaries. https://bit.ly/2yYKv6w #FAIRblog

author: MsAvaArmstrong
status: Nearly 110,000 DACA requestors out of nearly 889,000 (12%) had arrest records. Offenses in these arrest records include assault, battery, rape, murder and driving under the influence. (http://CIS.org)

author: KamalaHarris
status: Great news. Thank you @UofCalifornia and @calstate for stepping up to provide relief to DACA students and Dreamers after the Trump administration denied them financial support.

author: DiegoNSanchez
status: Make sure you’re informed about the latest news concerning DACA renewals as our country endures this global health emergency. Great content shared by @FWDus and @JuanSaaa.

author: Nimalo_Nisanto
status: Join us in a caravan outside of ICE and the AG office to send a message to the Supreme Court of the United States over the threat of ending DACA! If you’re in Phoenix, the event page is here: https://facebook.com/events/s/daca-caravan-our-home-is-here/236950540876195/?ti=icl

author: RAICESTEXAS
status: “It’s a false choice to think that in the middle of a pandemic we have to wait on the Supreme Court to potentially decide the fate of the hundreds of thousands of DACA recipients and their families.”

author: MarisitaMo
status: I met a brilliant, wise beyond her years, incredibly kind young woman. She has lived in CO since she was 1 year old, she never got to apply for DACA. She will graduate this year and has big dreams to become an aero space engineer. Her dreams and her future matter, her #HomeIsHere
